result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas L Longacre was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time. Sentence credit of 11 days were granted.
Consecutive to: Cases 15CM820, 15CM1752 and any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.
Attend the Victim Impact Panel meeting as ordered on 15CM820.
DAY REPORT CENTER - Comply with DRC for 6 Months consecutive to Jail time on 15CM820 & 15CM1752.

No Contact with Bobbi K.B., Jessie M., Jeremiah G., and Marshall T. No Contact with any victims or witnesses listed in the criminal complaint. Maintain full time employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. Case 15CM813 is dismissed and read in. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 12-21-2015 08:30 am
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court, in custody, with attorney Jess Martinez.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 2,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.  Attorney Martinez requests the court grant huber bailiff status.  The State objects to a bail modification.  The Court denies the request.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing at 11-30-2015 03:30 pm

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez for Jess Martinez.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez advises the Court the Defendant has recently been charged on 15CM2126 and requesting additional time for negotiations on the other case.  The Court sets the matter for another jury status prior to the trial.  Attorney Martinez requests the Court modify the bail to include Huber bailee status with SCRAM monitoring.  The State objects to the bail motion.  The Court denies the request for bail modification.  Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on:  11/24/15.
Hearing at 11-24-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State has just received a new referral. State had a global resolution on all the cases that will change the offer now.  Defense requests to enter a plea today. Court will pass the matter. Case recalled. State addresses the global offer. OWI 2nd addressed. Defense responds. Defense requests another date to review the new OWI case. Court will adjourn the trial. Court will give another jury status/jury trial date on 15CM813. Cases 15CM820, 15CM937 and 15CM1752 to trail along.  Amended Complaint to be filed on 10/12/1015 in file 15CM820.  Hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 10/8/15.
Hearing at 10-08-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has a new case - 15CM1752. Parties are going to work out a global offer. Defense requests the trial date be removed and these matters be set for plea sentencing date in two weeks. Court will reschedule 15CM813 to a new jury status/jury trial date and 15CM820, 15CM937 and 15CM1752 to trail along. Defense requests to address bail on all of defendant's files. Court grants request. Defense is requesting huber bailee status on all four files - 15CM813, 15CM820, 15CM937 and 15CM1752. State takes no position. Court grants huber bailee status.  Hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on September 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court with attorney Jess Martinez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense states these cases may resolve if there is a global offer, but requests a date for jury status/jury trial on 15CM813. 15CM820 and 15CM937 to trail along. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
